projects: [{'title': 'Biolab Batch 3', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The team of the Human Spaceflight department at OHB System in Bremen will develop “LUX in Space” experiment” to analyze the kinetics of enzymatic repair reactions of bacteria after irradiation. In space the cosmic irradiation affects cells by cell inactivation, mutation induction or chromosomal anomalies. The question is if the radiation effects are modified by microgravity or not. DNA lesions are fixed by intracellular repair mechanisms. This experiment examines if these repair mechanisms are affected by microgravity. The knowledge of biological space radiation effects as well as the impact of microgravity is mandatory for risk assessment for long term space missions.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Luca', 'last_name': 'Facciolati', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Payload Integration Manager for the European Space Agency at Telespazio Belgium'}]}, {'title': 'Exobiology Facility', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Luca', 'last_name': 'Facciolati', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Payload Integration Manager for the European Space Agency at Telespazio Belgium'}]}, {'title': 'ArgoMoon', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'ArgoMoon is a small satellite, in particular a 6U cubesat that we are currently designing and it will be launched in 2018 onto the new NASA SLS within the EM-1 mission.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Luca', 'last_name': 'Facciolati', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Payload Integration Manager for the European Space Agency at Telespazio Belgium'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Anna', 'last_name': 'Frosi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'System Engineering Manager at Thales Alenia Space'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Claudio', 'last_name': 'Galbiati', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Aeronautical Engineer'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alessandro', 'last_name': 'Lamberti', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Ingegnere'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Valerio', 'last_name': 'Di Tana', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Head of Programs - ▪ Responsible for mechanical and thermal design, as well as system CAD configuration for ISS payloads; 
▪ Responsible for integration activities of ISS payloads as well as supporting the test plan definition, test procedures writing, tests execution, and reporting (i.e. material chemical compatibility, vibration, thermal cycling, leak/proof, functional, radiation, physical properties);
